title: Freddie Fox looks the part as mass murderer Jeremy Bamber in new ITV drama
text:

Actor Freddie Fox is a dead ringer for warped Jeremy ­Bamber as he re-creates the killer’s bizarre “howling” at his slaughtered family’s funeral.

The 30-year-old – who is the son of Day of the Jackal star Edward Fox and brother of Silent Witness star Emilia – dyed his blond hair for the ITV drama about the fiend.

Bamber is serving a full life sentence for the 1985 shootings of sister Sheila Caffell, her six-year-old twins Daniel and Nicholas, and adoptive parents Nevill and June – but still maintains his innocence.

The series, out early next year, is being made with the support of Sheila’s estranged husband Colin Caffell, who wrote book In Search of Rainbow’s End on the tragedy.

Police at first thought Sheila, a model with schizophrenia known as Bambi, carried out the killings at White House Farm in Tolleshunt D’Arcy, Essex, then turned the gun on herself.

But DS Stan Jones, played by Mark Addy, had doubts about brother Bamber, 24 at the time, who had called police saying his sister had gone “berserk”.

Evidence showed Sheila, played by Prince Harry ’s ex Cressida Bonas, could not have shot herself twice or left blood on a silencer that was downstairs when her body was found upstairs.

(Image: Collect)

(Image: PA)

(Image: Mirrorpix)

Bamber’s then girlfriend, Julie Mugford, also said he had planned the deaths over 18 months.

The six-parter is written by The Slap’s Kris Mrksa.

Executive producer Willow Grylls said: “This case has been the subject of much debate and our programme focuses on the impact of the human tragedy.”

White House Farm will air on ITV in early 2020.
description: White House Farm tells the story of killer Jeremy ­Bamber, played by actor Freddie Fox, and the murder of his family
